segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5
6. Hindrances
54. Times Good for Meditation
“Mendicants, there are five times that are not good for meditation.
What five?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu jiṇṇo hoti jarāyābhibhūto.
segments.en: Firstly, a mendicant is old, overcome with old age.
This is the first time that’s not good for meditation.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu byādhito hoti byādhinābhibhūto.
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant is sick, overcome by sickness.
This is the second time that’s not good for meditation.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, dubbhikkhaṃ hoti dussassaṃ dullabhapiṇḍaṃ, na sukaraṃ uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ.
segments.en: Furthermore, there’s a famine, a bad harvest, so it’s hard to get alms-food, and not easy to keep going by collecting alms.
This is the third time that’s not good for meditation.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhayaṃ hoti aṭavisaṅkopo, cakkasamārūḷhā jānapadā pariyāyanti.
segments.en: Furthermore, there’s peril from wild savages, and the countryfolk mount their vehicles and flee everywhere.
This is the fourth time that’s not good for meditation.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, saṅgho bhinno hoti.
segments.en: Furthermore, there’s a schism in the Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Saṅghe kho pana, bhikkhave, bhinne aññamaññaṃ akkosā ca honti, aññamaññaṃ paribhāsā ca honti, aññamaññaṃ parikkhepā ca honti, aññamaññaṃ pariccajā ca honti.
segments.en: When the Saṅgha is split, they abuse, insult, block, and reject each other.

segments.pli: Tattha appasannā ceva nappasīdanti, pasannānañca ekaccānaṃ aññathattaṃ hoti.
segments.en: This doesn’t inspire confidence in those without it, and it causes some with confidence to change their minds.
This is the fifth time that’s not good for meditation.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca asamayā padhānāyāti.
segments.en: These are the five times that are not good for meditation.
There are five times that are good for meditation.
What five?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu daharo hoti yuvā susu kāḷakeso bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā.
segments.en: Firstly, a mendicant is a youth, young, black-haired, blessed with youth, in the prime of life.
This is the first time that’s good for meditation.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu appābādho hoti appātaṅko, samavepākiniyā gahaṇiyā samannāgato nātisītāya nāccuṇhāya majjhimāya padhānakkhamāya.
segments.en: Furthermore, they are rarely ill or unwell. Their stomach digests well, being neither too hot nor too cold, but just right, and fit for meditation.
This is the second time that’s good for meditation.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, subhikkhaṃ hoti susassaṃ sulabhapiṇḍaṃ, sukaraṃ uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ.
segments.en: Furthermore, there’s plenty of food, a good harvest, so it’s easy to get alms-food, and easy to keep going by collecting alms.
This is the third time that’s good for meditation.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, manussā samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā khīrodakībhūtā aññamaññaṃ piyacakkhūhi sampassantā viharanti.
segments.en: Furthermore, people live in harmony, appreciating each other, without quarreling, blending like milk and water, and regarding each other with kindly eyes.
This is the fourth time that’s good for meditation.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, saṃgho samaggo sammodamāno avivadamāno ekuddeso phāsu viharati.
segments.en: Furthermore, the Saṅgha lives comfortably, in harmony, appreciating each other, without quarreling, with one recitation.

segments.pli: Saṃghe kho pana, bhikkhave, samagge na ceva aññamaññaṃ akkosā honti, na ca aññamaññaṃ paribhāsā honti, na ca aññamaññaṃ parikkhepā honti, na ca aññamaññaṃ pariccajā honti.
segments.en: When the Saṅgha is in harmony, they don’t abuse, insult, block, or reject each other.

segments.pli: Tattha appasannā ceva pasīdanti, pasannānañca bhiyyobhāvo hoti.
segments.en: This inspires confidence in those without it, and increases confidence in those who have it.
This is the fifth time that’s good for meditation.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca samayā padhānāyā”ti.
segments.en: These are the five times that are good for meditation.”
